keyMoments.title: Sterry's Debut as Sabo's Adopted Brother
keyMoments.description: Sterry is introduced as the 8-year-old boy adopted by Outlook III and Didit to replace Sabo. He acts respectfully in front of his adoptive parents but privately shows disdain for Sabo, expressing relief that the 'real son' stayed away.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces Sterry as a foil to Sabo, showing what happens when a child fully embraces noble society's values. His adoption demonstrates how nobles view children as replaceable assets.
keyMoments.quote: I would have preferred that the 'real son' did not return.

keyMoments.title: Sterry Reveals the Gray Terminal Burning Plot
keyMoments.description: Sterry casually informs Sabo that the nobles decided months ago to burn down Gray Terminal before the World Nobles' visit in three days, treating the mass murder as a routine matter of clearing up an 'eyesore.'
keyMoments.significance: Reveals Sterry's complete absorption of noble values and his indifference to human life. His casual tone while discussing genocide shows how deeply corrupt noble society is.
keyMoments.quote: It was decided months ago in the upper echelon to set the Gray Terminal on fire the next day. The World Nobles are coming in three days, and they don't want them to see the eyesore of the country.

relationships.description: Sterry was adopted by Sabo's parents to replace him. While he acts respectfully in front of adults, he privately dislikes Sabo and views him as competition.

evolutionMoments.description: Sterry meets Sabo for the first time after being adopted into the family.

relationships.description: Outlook III adopted Sterry at age 8 because he showed promise. Sterry learned to mimic his adoptive father's dismissive attitudes toward the lower classes.

evolutionMoments.description: Sterry lives as the adopted son of Outlook III, fully embracing noble values.

reveals.information: Was adopted by Outlook III and Didit at age 8 because he 'showed promise'
Acts respectfully in front of nobles but shows his true contemptuous nature in private
Knows about the nobles' plan to burn Gray Terminal and shows complete indifference to the mass murder

keyMoments.title: Sabo Finds the Telescope
keyMoments.description: While searching Gray Terminal, Sabo discovers a telescope that Luffy wanted, showing his care for his brother. This moment of joy is immediately interrupted by the Bluejam Pirates surrounding him.
keyMoments.significance: The telescope symbolizes the brothers' dreams of adventure and freedom, making its discovery particularly poignant just before Sabo loses his freedom.

keyMoments.title: Sabo Sacrifices His Freedom for His Brothers
keyMoments.description: Faced with threats to Ace and Luffy's lives, Sabo agrees to return home with his father and abandon his life of freedom, sacrificing everything he values to protect his brothers.
keyMoments.significance: This is the defining moment of Sabo's character, demonstrating his selflessness and the depth of his bond with Ace and Luffy. This sacrifice drives his entire character arc and later revolutionary path.
keyMoments.quote: I'll go back... if you promise not to hurt them!

keyMoments.title: Sabo Learns of the Gray Terminal Genocide
keyMoments.description: Sterry reveals to Sabo that the nobles plan to burn down Gray Terminal and everyone in it the next day, purely to hide the 'eyesore' before the World Nobles visit.
keyMoments.significance: This revelation finalizes Sabo's understanding of how morally bankrupt noble society is and drives his desperate attempt to save his brothers and the Gray Terminal residents.

keyMoments.title: Sabo Escapes to Warn His Brothers
keyMoments.description: Despite knowing he'll be caught and possibly killed, Sabo escapes from High Town to run to Gray Terminal and warn Ace and Luffy about the impending fire.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Sabo's courage and loyalty, showing he'll risk everything to save his brothers. This represents his final rejection of noble society.

relationships.description: Sabo's bond with Ace is so strong that he willingly sacrifices his freedom to save Ace's life.

evolutionMoments.description: Sabo sacrifices his freedom and dreams to protect Ace and Luffy from being killed.

relationships.description: Sabo's bond with Luffy is so strong that he willingly sacrifices his freedom to save Luffy's life.

evolutionMoments.description: Sabo sacrifices his freedom and dreams to protect Ace and Luffy from being killed.

relationships.description: Sabo's biological father who views him as property and uses criminals to force him back into noble society. Their relationship is defined by Outlook's control and Sabo's resistance.

evolutionMoments.description: Outlook III hires the Bluejam Pirates to capture Sabo and 'take care of' his brothers, forcing Sabo to return.

relationships.description: Sterry was adopted to replace Sabo after he ran away. Their relationship is antagonistic, with Sterry viewing Sabo as an unwanted rival.

evolutionMoments.description: Sabo meets Sterry for the first time and learns he's been replaced by this ambitious noble child.

reveals.information: Willing to sacrifice everything, including his freedom and dreams, to protect his brothers
Learns about the nobles' plan to burn Gray Terminal and commit genocide

name.japanese: ポートガス・D・エース

keyMoments.title: Ace Captured by Bluejam Pirates
keyMoments.description: Ace arrives in a barrel to help Sabo but is captured along with Luffy by the Bluejam Pirates, who were hired by Sabo's father.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Ace's loyalty in trying to help Sabo, but also his powerlessness against the systematic oppression of noble society.

keyMoments.title: Ace Accepts Job from Bluejam
keyMoments.description: After Sabo is taken away, Bluejam offers Ace and Luffy jobs on his pirate crew. Ace agrees, unaware that he's being manipulated.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates how the oppressed are often forced to work for their oppressors, and sets up Ace's unwitting participation in distributing the explosives that will burn Gray Terminal.

keyMoments.title: Ace Unknowingly Distributes Explosives
keyMoments.description: Ace helps Bluejam move cargo boxes to marked locations throughout Gray Terminal, not realizing the boxes contain explosives and oil for the fire.
keyMoments.significance: Tragic irony where Ace unknowingly helps set up the massacre that will target him and the Gray Terminal residents.

relationships.description: Ace tries to help Sabo when he's surrounded but is captured. He witnesses Sabo's sacrifice.

evolutionMoments.description: Ace is powerless to stop Sabo from being taken away by his father.

relationships.description: Ace and Luffy work together after Sabo is taken, though they're being manipulated by Bluejam.

evolutionMoments.description: Ace and Luffy are captured together and forced to work for Bluejam.

keyMoments.title: Luffy Captured by Bluejam Pirates
keyMoments.description: Luffy arrives in a barrel with Ace to help Sabo but is captured by the Bluejam Pirates.
keyMoments.significance: Shows young Luffy's loyalty to his brothers but also his vulnerability to adult schemes and power.

keyMoments.title: Luffy Unknowingly Distributes Explosives
keyMoments.description: Luffy helps Bluejam move cargo boxes throughout Gray Terminal, unaware they contain explosives and oil for the planned fire.
keyMoments.significance: Shows young Luffy's trusting nature being exploited by those in power, a recurring theme in his journey.

relationships.description: Luffy tries to help Sabo when surrounded but is captured. Sabo sacrifices his freedom to save Luffy's life.

evolutionMoments.description: Luffy is unable to prevent Sabo from being taken away.

relationships.description: Luffy and Ace work together after Sabo is taken, though they're being manipulated.

evolutionMoments.description: Luffy and Ace are captured together and forced to work for Bluejam.

keyMoments.title: Bluejam Captures the Three Brothers
keyMoments.description: Bluejam and his crew successfully capture Sabo, Ace, and Luffy, revealing they were hired by Sabo's father for this purpose.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals Bluejam as a tool of the nobles, showing how criminals are used by the powerful to do their dirty work.

keyMoments.title: Bluejam Offers Ace and Luffy Jobs
keyMoments.description: Rather than killing Ace and Luffy as suggested by Outlook, Bluejam sees an opportunity to use them and offers them jobs on his crew.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Bluejam's pragmatic cruelty and his ability to manipulate vulnerable children for his own purposes.

keyMoments.title: Bluejam Has Ace and Luffy Distribute Explosives
keyMoments.description: Bluejam convinces Ace and Luffy to help move cargo boxes to marked locations, boxes that actually contain explosives and oil for the Gray Terminal fire.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Bluejam's ruthless manipulation and willingness to use children as unwitting accomplices in mass murder.

relationships.description: Bluejam is hired by Outlook III to capture Sabo and deal with Ace and Luffy. This transactional relationship shows how nobles use criminals.

evolutionMoments.description: Bluejam reveals he was hired by Outlook III to retrieve Sabo.

relationships.description: Bluejam captures Sabo on behalf of his father, serving as the enforcer of noble will.

evolutionMoments.description: Bluejam captures Sabo and delivers him to his father.

reveals.information: Hired by nobles to capture Sabo and has been contracted to burn down Gray Terminal

keyMoments.title: Outlook III Reveals Himself as Sabo's Father
keyMoments.description: Outlook III appears when the brothers are captured and is revealed to have hired the Bluejam Pirates to retrieve his runaway son and eliminate his companions.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals the lengths to which nobles will go to maintain control over their children and their willingness to use violence to enforce their will.

keyMoments.title: Outlook III Participates in Genocide Planning
keyMoments.description: Sabo overhears Outlook III and other nobles discussing the plan to burn Gray Terminal, showing their complete indifference to mass murder.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Outlook III as complicit in the systematic genocide planned by the nobles, showing the depth of noble moral corruption.

relationships.description: Outlook III views Sabo as property and an asset for advancing family status rather than as a person. He hires criminals to force Sabo back into noble society.

evolutionMoments.description: Outlook III forces Sabo to return home by threatening Ace and Luffy's lives.

relationships.description: Outlook III hires Bluejam to capture Sabo and deal with his brothers, showing how nobles use criminals as tools.

evolutionMoments.description: Outlook III's arrangement with Bluejam is revealed.

relationships.description: Outlook III adopted Sterry to replace Sabo as his heir when Sabo ran away.

evolutionMoments.description: Sabo discovers that his father has replaced him with an adopted son.

reveals.information: Views his son as property and is willing to hire criminals to enforce his control
Complicit in the nobles' plan to burn Gray Terminal and commit genocide
